info.title: e-Attestations 'EDGE' API
info.description:
# üöÄ The evergreening 'EDGE' API


![Logo](https://e-attestations.io/img/logo-e-Attestations-tech.png)


**Thank you** dear reader for reading this documentation that l'Atelier at e-attestations made with ‚ù§.



## Objectives

e-Attestations EDGE API is used to ** interface ** a **client** information system with the e-Attestations platform following the HTTP protocol.

[REST] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer) (Representational State Transfer) or RESTful is a style of architecture used to build applications (Web, Intranet, Web Service) by using endpoints ( endpoints urls) and referencing resources to be exploited according to the verbs of the HTTP protocol (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE etc ...).

## Principles

Our APIs contain predictable resource-oriented URLs, that accept request bodies encoded in [JSON](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON) format, that return encoded responses [JSON](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON) and that use standard HTTP responses codes (200, 404, etc.), with a HTTP authentication using headers and HTTP verbs (GET, POST, etc.).

The 'Client' application that uses the e-Attestations 'EDGE' API can enrich/enhance custome's Information System with data and processes provided and developped by e-Attestations in a secure and very flexible manner.

## Use Cases

The 'EDGE' API can be used by any system which can interact through the Internet, like :

- WebApps
- Mobiles Apps
- Busioness Application or platform (SAP, SalesForce...), 
- Any software that consumes REST, or API connectors (Zapier, ZohoCRM, etc.).


## Postman collection

We provide you with a pretty huge Postman collection that you can find  [here](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/3000526/TVKD3xcz)

Feel free to explore all the scenario we shared with you !

You can let the tool write the code for you !


## How we wrote this documentation ?


This documentation has been written by us, L'Atelier at e-Attestations, the team of conceptors and developpers who develop everything :-)

Because we love read good documentation, we wrote this one thinking as developer for the best developer experience possible.

Because we though that that was not enough, you will find more resources on [https://e-attestations.io](https://e-attestations.io) like Posman collection, scripts, a CLI (in active developement), articles and more.

Visit [https://e-attestations.io](https://e-attestations.io)


## Contact us

You want to subscribe, get credentials, send somme feeback ? 

Feel free to contact us by email at [api@eattestationscom.zohodesk.eu](mailto:api@eattestationscom.zohodesk.eu)

/account.summary: This resource is the ordering customer and service subscriber to e-Attestations account.
/account.description:
This resource is the ordering customer and service subscriber to e-Attestations account.

The account identifier is returned in the `account_ids` returned in the JWT token.

In addition, you can also retrieve your account identifier from the `/account` endpoint without any parameters.

All requests must include the customer identifier so that every time the account's activation and subscription to the service are verified

schema.description: The response has a 'content' property containing statistics and an optional messages attribute (info, warn or error)

200.description: The account information associated with the TOKEN allows to know the account id and subscription to the service.

/account/{accountId}.description: Provides the overall statistics of the account.

schema.description: The response has a 'content' property containing statistics and an optional messages attribute (info, warn or error)

200.description: Gloable statistics and statistics by indicators. An indicator refers to a subset of required documents. Eg For the indicator "obligation of vigilance", the statistics will relate only to the documents of the obligation of vigilance, namely the certificate of vigilance, the proof of registration and the list of foreign employees subject to work authorization .

get.description: Fetches the overall statistics of the account. The statistics relate only to the third parties monitored. A monitored Thirdparty is a Thirdparty for which there is at least one active dossier. The statistics relate to third parties and dossiers completeness.

/account/{accountId}/thirdparties/{third.description: You use this endpoint with the thirdpartyId and fetch its details data representation.

200.description: Returns a JSON word containing detailed information from the Thirdparty

404.description: No account with this identifier (accountId) ou aucun tiers avec cet identifiant(thirdpartyId).

/account/{accountId}/dossiers/{dossierId.summary: Fetch dossier details based on the given id

404.description: No account with this identifier (accountId), ou aucun dossier avec cet identifiant (dossierId).

requestBody.description: Data to update for a dossier

400.description: Error in the body of the request. Check error message for details

404.description: No account with this identifier (accountId), ou aucun dossier avec cet identifiant (dossierId).

post.description:
Update one data's dossier (synchronously)

## Error codes

During the update, the API can raise an error that you have to interpret and adapt you logic/coding on.

This is the error code list you need to know.

Codes | Errors when updating a folder
-----|---------------------------------
E200 | There is no dossier for this criteria
E201 | This dossier is disabled
E202 | This dossier reference already exists for this client / supplier couple
E203 | There is no dossier for this reference
E204 | This dossier is already active
E205 | This dossier to reactivate has an outdated date for its re-activation. Please provide a date in the future.
E301 | This document/requirement is deactivated
E302 | This document/requirement is not authorized

/account/{accountId}/dossiers/{dossierId.description: Fetch the documents set for this dossier.

404.description: No account with this identifier (accountId), ou aucun dossier avec cet identifiant (dossierId).

200.description: Retourne les d√©tails d'un documents d'un dossier.

404.description: No account with this identifier (accountId), ou aucun dossier avec cet identifiant (dossierId) ou aucun document avec et identiant

get.description: Download a copy of the content of the last active evidence content of the file. Client system have to name it and save it.

400.description: Malformed request ou Dossier d√©j√† non suivi.

404.description: No account with this identifier (accountId), ou aucun dossier avec cet identifiant (dossierId).

post.description: Stop monitoring and workflow. The thirdpary won't bas ask anymore for dossier's requirements

requestBody.description: Data to update for one dossier

400.description: Malformed request ou Dossier d√©j√† suivi ou date d'expiration dans le pass√©.

404.description: No account with this identifier (accountId), ou aucun dossier avec cet identifiant (dossierId).

post.description: Reactivate this dossier and restart continuus monitoring

/account/{accountId}/requirements.description:
Your account is allowed and configurer to use a set of requirment that you can use in your dossier.

Find more information on this configuration by contacting your e-Attestations key account manager.

200.description: Array of requirement as document type code

get.description: List of available requirement configured for the given account

404.description: No account with this identifier (accountId), ou aucun dossier avec cet identifiant (dossierId).

items.title: Requirement as a document type code

post.summary: Update requirement for an active dossier
post.description: Add one or more requirement for an active dossier by giving the list documentCodes

get.summary: Status of dossier creation async process
get.description: Status/completeness of a dossier creation by its processId

content.description: JSON Array indicating the import status of one or more dossier creation from current day -1

200.description: Returns an array of JSON objects, indicating the status and the result of imports.

get.description:
Used to find out the results of on or several dossier creation.

If the fromDate parameter is specified, the import results that will be returned are those which were launched from that date.

By default, the dossier creation results launched in the last 24 hours are returned.

/account/{accountId}/dossiers.description:
Get array/list of dossiers in a paginated manner. 

By default the API will send back the first page with 10 dossiers per page. You can specify the page you need with parameters.

We've developed many capabilities on this new search experience.

You can eigher :

- Get dossiers with no criteria, it's paginated by default
- Get all dossiers at once with '/all' path parameter
- Get dossiers depending on criteria, commbining them if you want
- Get dossiers depending on thirdpartyCode or dossierReference with an ('op') that can be either:
    * `like` : which means 'contains'   
    * `starts` : which means starts with the given value
    * `ends` : which means ends with the given value

In the following example we use a search by `tva` AND `thirdpartyCode` with the operator `like` :

```sh
curl 'https://{{ea_api_serv}}/api/v1/account/<your account id>/dossiers?tva=FR79811386366&thirdpartyCode=TEST&op=like' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer <your access_token>''
```

parameters.name: thirdpartyId
parameters.description: Identify e-Attestations of the Thirdparty. This is different from the companyIdValue. The thirdpartyId is a technical identifier that uniquely identifies the Thirdparty in the eAttestations platform.

parameters.name: companyIdType
parameters.description: Third-party company identifier type (CIT001, CIT002 etc.).

parameters.name: companyIdValue
parameters.description: Filtering by company value (depends on company type)

parameters.name: thirdpartyCode
parameters.description: Thirdparty external ID (from user input or external system)

parameters.name: dossierReference
parameters.description: Allows you to filter by dossier reference. As the dossier reference is unique for a third party / dossier, if this parameter is entered, a maximum of one dossier will be returned.

parameters.name: monitored
parameters.description: Filter allowing to return monitored dossiers (monitored = true) or not followed (monitored = false)

parameters.name: stateLastChangeDate
parameters.description: Filter allowing you to return only dossiers with completeness that has changed since a given date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paging parameter indicating the page number.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Pagination parameter indicating the desired page size.

parameters.name: op
parameters.description:
An operator that works in conjonction with query parameters 'thirdpartyCode' or 'dossierRefence' (only).

Operator can be either : 

- 'like' : means contains the given value
- 'starts' : means begins with the given value
- 'ends' : means ends with the given value

200.description: Returns an array of JSON objects. Each item contains information from a folder.

get.description:
Fetch dossiers list, paginated.

You can specify pageSize and page for navigation between pages.

You can also use criteria and combine query parameters.

## Error codes 

During your search API can send an error that you need to interpret.

Here the error codes you can have.

Codes| Search errors
-----|---------------------------------
E001 | Missing parameter
E002 | Unknown parameter
E003 | Empty parameter
E010 | Incorrect format
E011 | Maximum size exceeded
E021 | Expiration date in the past
E022 | Date in the future
E030 | Invalid email domain

requestBody.description: Dossier's Data to create. Contains thirdpary code information, dossier details etc. Check the body description for details

200.description: Success ful creation. ProcessId is provided.

post.description:
Launch e-Attestations internal processes for continuus monitoring for thirdparty compliancy.

Create a dossier for a new thirdparty (not already monitored) starts the invitation workflow (by email). Thus, all information are important during this phase.

### Purpose of a 'dossier'

The 'dossier' allows the client to monitor one of his thirdparty for one or a number of required documents.

It is the management unit of requirements (documents) for one thirdparty.

Available requirements/documents depends your subscription and account configuration. 

Contact your key account manager for any questions on configuration. 

### Forge your compliance requirements through document type codes

A dossier will process and manage gathering of data or invite your third party if the evidence for this document is not available or is not valid anymore (expiretion date). 

Each requirement is also called a documents (for which we aim to obtain an evidence) is represented through a 'document code' that you have to recognize in order to ask for the good requirements and reach evidences for this 'dossier'.

This document code as been designed by e-Attestations for years.

### Asynchronous process for a better control

We process dossier creation asynchronously so you don't have to wait :-)

It's a very powerful mecanism, giving a lot of flexibility and adaptability for the customer/system using APIs.

'Dossier' creation is an **asynchronous process**. This asynchronism is induced by the process (itself of an asynchronous nature) of qualification of Thirdparty information by our internal data sources.

This endpoint launches the import process and returns a process identifier (processId).

The processing can last few minutes. In order to follow the progress of the import process and to know its result, a client can check the specific processid and know if the asynchronous creation process is complete and successful.

![Dossier creation illustration](https://e-attestations.io/img/ea-create-dossier-async.png)

### What if the thirdparty doesn't exist ?

If the thirdparty does not exist, it is created in the eAttestations platform.

This is why we need thirdparty identifier composed using `companyIdType` code and `companyIdalue` value.

We advise you to always use your own keys (from your database or system) with the field `thirdpartyCode`.

### Error codes

During dossier creation API can raise error codes.

this is the error codes you need to know and adapt you logic uppon.

Codes | Errors when creating a folder
-----|----------------------------------
E100 | There is no third party for this criteria
E101 | Error when qualifying the establishment
E102 | The establishment does not exist
E103 | The establishment is closed
E104 | Too many third parties for this criteria
E112 | The supplier code (thirdpartyCode) already used for another supplier
E113 | Non active ordering account
E121 | Impossible to create a dossier based on TVA for a french thirdparty. Plesae use SIRET number
E122 | Impossible to import a non French thirdparty, subscription is inactive for international third parties

/account/{accountId}/thirdparties.description:
You can use field query parameters for thirdparty list/array.

The result can be used in a list in a Webpage or a quite large yet simple list to display.

parameters.name: monitored
parameters.description: Allows filtering on monitored third parties (monitored = true) or non-monitored third parties (monitored = false)

parameters.name: companyIdType
parameters.description: Third-party company identifier type (CIT001, CIT002 etc.).

parameters.name: companyIdValue
parameters.description: Allows you to filter by Thirdparty company identifier. The identifier can be a SIRET or a VAT Number.

parameters.name: stateLastChangeDate
parameters.description: Filter to return third parties whose overall status has changed since that date.

parameters.name: thirdpartyGlobalState
parameters.description: Filter to return third parties whose overall completeness is "complete" (true) or "incomplete" (false)

parameters.name: subscriptionState
parameters.description: Allows you to filter on the registration status of a Thirdparty. This parameter allows to return the registered (subscriptionState = true) or non-registered (subscriptionState = false) third parties

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paging parameter indicating the page number.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Pagination parameter indicating the desired page size.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: An operator for querying with search criteria.

200.description: Returns an array of JSON objects. Each item contains the identification information of a Thirdparty (The eAttestations identifier of the Thirdparty, the type of company identifier, the company identifier of the Thirdparty and the Thirdparty code).

get.description:
On its simplest form, gets array/list of thirparties with pagination. 


## Pagination

Like 'dossiers' the pagination is 10 thirdparies per page by default.


- Get thirdparties : `/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties`


- Using pagination (fetching here 100 thirdparties at once): `/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties?page=0&pageSize=100`


## Advanced search critiera

### Using field with exact values

You have various ways for search criterias request parameters with a value to search.

You can request with main requested fields :

  - By SIREN id : `https://{{ea_api_serv}}/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties?siren=503829368`
  - By SIRET id : `https://{{ea_api_serv}}/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties?siret=43258335900109`
  - By TVA id   : `https://{{ea_api_serv}}/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties?tva=B26492108`
  - By Name     : `https://{{ea_api_serv}}/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties?name=ThirdpartyName`

But also thirdparties that :

  - are monitored : `https://{{ea_api_serv}}/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties?monitored=true`
  - are monitored : `https://{{ea_api_serv}}/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties?monitored=false`
  - have changed since a specific date : `https://{{ea_api_serv}}/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties?stateLastChangeDate=2020-06-01`
 
### Using advanced search criteria on any fields

This is the most powerfull way for advanced search.

Checkout the `/account/{accountId}/thirdparties/q` resources for more details

/account/{accountId}/thirdparties/q.summary: Search for detailed thirdparties based on complex search criteria
/account/{accountId}/thirdparties/q.description:
Request **thirdparties details** by a combinaison of search criteria.

This is a very powerful and flexible search tool.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search query using any field from Thirdparty ressource, using operators and combine them together

200.description: Returns a JSON word containing detailed information from the Thirdparty

404.description: No account with this identifier (accountId) ou aucun tiers avec cet identifiant(thirdpartyId).

get.description:
Request thirdparties details by a query search criteria.
This is a very powerful and flexible search tool.


### Using any field with operators

The general form for this search is :

`q?search=<your criteria>`


The criteria is/are composed of :

- a field name that as one of types : string, date or a numeric (but not a boolean)
- an operator which could be either :
    * `:` : equals
    * `~` : contains/like
    * `!` : not equals
    * `>` : greater than
    * `<` : less than
- a value to search for

exemple : 

```http
{{ea_api_serv}}/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties/q?search=workforce<2000
```

### Using more than on criteria and combine them with 'AND' and 'OR'

With this feature you can request **thirdparties details** by a composition of search criteria composed with the help of AND/and, OR/or with parenthesis.

The general form for this search is :

`q?search=( <first criteria> <AND|OR> <second criteria> )`

or 

`q?search=( <first criteria> <AND|OR> <second criteria> ) <AND|OR> <third criteria>`


Note that you can use per criteria :

- 'AND' or 'and' for the AND operator
- 'OR' or 'or' for the OR operator


Note the parenthesis need a space after and before it in order to let the search engine to find the criteria token.

Examples : 

- Requesting thirdparties with workforce > 200 and are active OR workforce < 2 :

```http
{{ea_api_serv}}/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties/q?search=( workforce>200 AND isActive:true ) OR workforce<2
```

With curl :

Notice then encoded characters for spaces and operators

```sh
curl '{{ea_api_serv}}/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties/q?search=(%20workforce%3E200%20AND%20isActive:true%20)%20OR%20workforce%3C2' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer <your access_token>'
```

id.description: Account ID To be used in all API calls

company.description: Name of the legal entity of the account

subscriptionDate.description: Date of subscription to the service

subscriptions.description: List of subscriptions for this account

numberOfThirdparties.description: The total number of thirds of the account.

numberOfSubscribedThirdparties.description: The total number of third parties registered for a client.

numberOfCompleteThirdparties.description: The total number of third parties for which all active dossiers are complete. In other words, the third parties who have submitted all the documents required by this client.

numberOfDossiers.description: The total number of active dossiers.

numberOfCompleteDossiers.description: The total number of complete dossiers. In other words, the dossiers for which all the required documents have been uploaded but the third party.

listIndicatorsStatistics.description: Table containing statistics by indicator (E.g. Obligation of vigilance).

StatisticsIndicator.title: Statistics indicator
StatisticsIndicator.description: Statistics on each e-Attestations indicators (a.k.a. Obligation of vigilance = I001).

numberOfThirdparties.description: The number of thirds of the ordering customer account restricted on this indicator.

numberOfSubscribedThirdparties.description: The number of third parties registered restricted on this indicator.

numberOfCompleteThirdparties.description: The number of third parties for which all the dossiers are complete, restricted on this indicator.

numberOfDossiers.description: The number of accounts in the account, restricted on this indicator.

numberOfCompleteDossiers.description: The number of complete accounts in the account, restricted on this indicator.

NewDossier.title: Dossier to be created
NewDossier.description: Body of the dossier to be created

companyIdType.description: Thirdparty's company type of identifier ('CIT001' for SIRET, 'CIT002' for VAT)

companyIdValue.description: Thirdparty company identifier (SIRET or intra community VAT)

thirdpartyCode.description: Thirdparty code. It is an internal identifier for the client

expirationDate.description: Dossier's expiration date. After this date, the third party is no longer monitored

thirdpartyEmail.description: List of emails from third-party contacts. If a Thirdparty is not registered, these emails will be used to send the invitations.

userInCharge.description: List of emails from those responsible for the file on the ordering side. If an email does not correspond to any registered user, an invitation to register on the ordering e-Attestations platform is sent to this Email.

complete.description: true if the dossier creation is complete, false otherwise

success.description: true if the dossier creation is sucessful, false otherwise

isComplete.description: 'true' if the dossier creation is complete, 'false' otherwise

isSuccessful.description: 'true' if the dossier creation is successful, 'false' otherwise

ThirdpartyIdentifier.title: Thirdparty identifier
ThirdpartyIdentifier.description: JSON word representing the identifying information of a Thirdparty.

thirdpartyId.description: Identify e-Attestations of the Thirdparty. This is different from the companyIdValue. The thirdpartyId is a technical identifier that uniquely identifies the Thirdparty in the eAttestations platform.

companyIdType.description: Third-party company identifier type (CIT001, CIT002 etc.).

companyIdValue.description: Third-party company identifier (SIRET or intra-community VAT).

thirdpartyCode.description: Thirdparty code. It is an internal client identifier.

ThirdpartyDetails.title: Details of a Thirdparty
ThirdpartyDetails.description: JSON word representing Details of a Thirdparty. The information constituting the address as well as the corporate name of the Thirdparty is provided by our Data Provider from the identifier of the Thirdparty.

thirdpartyId.description: Identify e-Attestations of the Thirdparty. This is different from the companyIdValue. The thirdpartyId is a technical identifier that uniquely identifies the Thirdparty in the eAttestations platform.

companyIdType.description: Third-party company identifier type (CIT001, CIT002, CIT003 etc.).

thirdpartyCode.description: Thirdparty code. It is an external client identifier that should be used to identify the thirdparty based on an external system or a database.

monitored.description: Indicates whether the Thirdparty is being followed. This attribute is true if the Thirdparty is followed, false otherwise. A Thirdparty is followed up as soon as they have a followed up file.

name.description: Thirdparty company name. This is automatically provided by our data provider using the Thirdparty identifier (Siret number or VAT number)

subscriptionState.description: Thirdparty registration status. True if the Thirdparty is registered, False otherwise.

outOfBusiness.description: Indicates whether the establishment is closed. True if it is, False otherwise.

stateLastChangeDate.description: Last date on which the overall state of the Thirdparty changed.

thirdpartyGlobalState.description:
Overall completeness of the Thirdparty. A value of true means that all dossiers are in the complete state.
A value of false (Incomplete) means that at least one or more dossiers are in the incomplete state.
A value of null (n/a) means that the thirdparty is not currently under account's monitoring.

capitalCurrency.description: Currency of known capital for the Thirdparty

datecreation.description: Date of creation of the Thirdparty in the eAttestations database

lastBalanceSheetDate.description: Last date of known operating income

siret.description: SIRET identifier of the establishment (for French thirdparties)

turnoverCurrency.description: Currency of last known third-party turnover

thirdpartyUsers.description: Information about the users of the third-party account.

isMonitored.description: Indicates whether the Thirdparty is being followed. This attribute is true if the Thirdparty is followed, false otherwise. A Thirdparty is followed up as soon as they have a followed up file.

isOutOfBusiness.description: Indicates whether the establishment is closed. True if it is, False otherwise.

isRegistered.description: Thirdparty registration status. 'true' if the Thirdparty is registered, 'false' otherwise.

isComplete.description:
Overall completeness of the Thirdparty.
- A value of 'true' (complete) means that all files are in the 'complete' state.
- A value of 'false' (uncomplete) means that at least one or more files are in the 'incomplete' state.
- A value of 'n/a' means that the thirdparty is not currently under account's monitoring.

active.description: Indicates if the third party has an activity

isActive.description: Indicates if the third party has an activity

phone.description: Num√©ro de t√©l√©phone de l'utilisateur au format international.

expirationDate.description: File expiration date. After this date, the file is no longer followed (Attribute "monitored" of the file changes to false)

thirdpartyCode.description: Thirdparty code. It is an internal client identifier.

thirdpartyEmail.description: List of emails from third-party contacts. If a Thirdparty is not registered, these emails will be used to send the invitations.

Dossier.title: Dossier
Dossier.description: Dossier content information, details, documents etc.

thirdpartyId.description: Identify e-Attestations of the Thirdparty. This is different from the companyIdValue. The thirdpartyId is a technical identifier that uniquely identifies the Thirdparty in the eAttestations platform.

companyIdType.description: Third-party company identifier type (CIT001, CIT002 etc.).

companyIdValue.description: Principal Thirdpary's company ID code (which is SIRET or TVA codes most of the time).

thirdpartyCode.description: Thirdparty Code. This code is an external key (a.k.a from within client system)

companyCountryCode.description: Third country code. This is an alpha-3 code from the ISO 3166-1 standard.

monitored.description: Indicates if the dossier is followed/active (True) or not followed (False)

expirationDate.description: Expiration date for follow-up From this date, the file automatically changes to the "not followed" state

stoppingReason.description: Details concerning the termination of the file: OUTOFBUSINESS (company canceled), EXPIRATION (the file has reached its expiration date), STOPREQUEST (a request to stop was made in an explicit and immediate manner), UNKNOWN (information absent). Not null only if folder deactivated.

state.description: Dossier completeness indicator. True if all the requested documents are present and valid, false otherwise.

stateLastChangeDate.description: Date of the last change in the completeness of the file.

indicators.description: List of indicators in the dossier.

documents.description: List of documents requested for the file.

isMonitored.description: Indicates if the dossier is followed/active (True) or not followed (False)

isComplete.description: String representation taht indicates "true" if the dossier is complete : all required documents are present and validated. "false" otherwise.

documents.documentName: Liste nominative des salari√©s √©trangers soumis √† autorisation de travail
documents.documentNameEn: List of names of posted workers subjected to work permit

Requirement.title: Requirement
Requirement.description: A requirement is a document/a form/a file for which e-Attestations aims to provide evidence

code.description: Internal Code identifying the requirement. This code is important for dossier creation.

descriptionCategoryFr.description: Description of the category of the requirement in French

descriptionCategoryEn.description: Description of the category of the requirement in English

descriptionFr.description: Description of the requirement in French

descriptionEn.description: Description of the requirement in English

DossierIndicator.title: Dossier indicator
DossierIndicator.description: Status of a dossier for completness or other kind of information

state.description: State of the indicator. True if all the requested documents of the indicator are present, false otherwise.

lastChangeDate.description: Date of the last change in the status of the indicator.

isComplete.description: State of the indicator. True if all the requested documents of the indicator are present, false otherwise.

Document.title: Document or evidence requested for the file
Document.description: A requirement such as a requested document, a signature, something to bring to the file

present.description: Represents the boolean of presence of the evidence.

isPresent.description: Represents the boolean as string of presence of the evidence.

evidences.description:
List of evidences linked to this requirement/document.
(For now) List only the very last know version of the evidence provided.

documentNameEn.description: Name of the document in english if translation exists. french otherwise.

example.documentName: Attestation de formation √† la cr√©ation-reprise d'entreprise
example.documentNameEn: Attestation de formation √† la cr√©ation-reprise d'entreprise

ReactivateDossierData.description: Information of the file to be updated when reactivating the follow-up.

expirationDate.description: Expiration date of the follow-up of the file. After this date, the file is no longer followed (Attribute "monitored" of the file changes to false).

Messages.description: Messages from a response to a REST / JSON API call. It contains information, warning and error messages.

ResponseDossierCreation.title: Reponse for a dossier creation
ResponseDossierCreation.description: Information with processId of dossier's creation an messages

Response.title: Root Type for content
Response.description: The content of a reponse is an Array of JSON Object depending of the request.

content.description: The content of the reponse for the request (when HTTP 200)

page.description: The page number when the response is paginated

size.description: The page size provided for this request

totalElements.description: The total number of elements for the requested resources.

messages.description: The messages provided for this reponse

DossierRequirement.title: Root Type for DossierRequirement
DossierRequirement.description: The requirement representation attached to a specific Dossier

ThirdpartyRepresentation.title: Root Type for ThirdpartyRepresentation
ThirdpartyRepresentation.description: Essential data of one thirdparty. This resource should be used in a list to display for instance.

thirdpartyId.description: Identify e-Attestations of the Thirdparty. This is different from the companyIdValue. The thirdpartyId is a technical identifier that uniquely identifies the Thirdparty in the eAttestations platform.

companyIdType.description: Third-party company identifier type (CIT001, CIT002, CIT003 etc.).

thirdpartyCode.description: Thirdparty code. It is an external client identifier that should be used to identify the thirdparty based on an external system or a database.

name.description: Thirdparty company name. This is automatically provided by our data provider using the Thirdparty identifier (Siret number or VAT number)

dateCreation.description: Date of creation of the Thirdparty in the eAttestations database

capitalCurrency.description: Currency of known capital for the Thirdparty

lastBalanceSheetDate.description: Last date of known operating income

Evidence.title: Evidence
Evidence.description: Evidence are provided/uploaded by thirdparties or automaticaly by e-Attestations

metadata.description: Data as a map of key and values depending on internal analysis

formdata.description: Array of field representation issued through form filled by one thirdparty

id.description:
Evidence Id. 
***This id is used for file content download.***

Metadata.title: Root Type for Metadata
Metadata.description: Metadata are a map of keys and values that represent the variable representation of data processed by e-Attestations

key.description: A variable string representing a key and its corresponding value

FormData.title: Root Type for FormField
FormData.description: A representation of an input from a form issue to user

type.description:
Types representation as string, that can be, either : 

- 'string'
- 'date'
- 'decimal'
- 'phone'
- 'text'
- 'amount'
- 'choices'
- 'number'
- 'radio'
- 'checkbox'
- 'email'
- 'iban'

key.description: A unique string taht represents the field name

order.description: Integer representing the ordered position in the form

value.description: The string representation of the value

DossierProcess.title: Root Type for DossierProcess2
DossierProcess.description: Dossier creation Process is provided to reflect the result and the parameters used for this dossier creation

complete.description: If the creation process is completed

success.description: true if the dossier create is successful

isComplete.description: It's the string representation of creation process completness.

isSuccessful.description: It's the string representation of creation process successful.

ErrorMessage.title: Root Type for ErrorMessage
ErrorMessage.description: Define the error message sent back during dossier creation or update.

code.description: The error code. Please consult the error nomenclature documentation for details.

message.description: The english errors for this code

request.description: The known request linked to this error.

reason.description: List of values involved in this error

response.description:
Reponses are provided with a :

    - content (JSON Array) : provinding the content for the request when it exists (HTTP 200)

    - messages (JSON Array) : (optinaly provided) proviging messages for INFO, WARM and ERRORS level.


The page number, page size and number total of elements are also provided (for main resources).

Bearer.description:
## Authenticate requests

To perform an authentication you must add an HTTP header in every requests in the form `Authorization: Bearer {JWT}` 
where 'access_code' is the attributes sent back within the JWT (Json Web Token) provided by e-Attestations authentication service.


### Get a JWT from the authenticator server

This request consist of a POST request with user/password and a client identifier 'ea-api-edge' to e-Attestations authentication and authorization server.

Credentials are verified by the auth server which send back a JWT (JSON Web Token) that user have to keep in ordre to use it for all subsequent requests to the API.

The token has a limited time which can be verified with 'expires_in' expressed in seconds.

Each request are authenticated with the access_token with a `Authorization: bearer <your access_token>` header.

![Authentication Illustration](https://e-attestations.io/img/EA_Graph_Security_Get_JWT_010.png)


## Using refresh token

You can also ask for an access_token by using the refresh token

```txt
Method: POST
URL: https://auth.test-e-attestations.com/auth/realms/eat_realm/protocol/openid-connect/token
Body type: x-www-form-urlencoded
Form fields:    
client_id : ea-api-edge
grant_type : refresh_token
refresh_token: <your-refresh-token>
```

tags.name: Account
tags.description: Your e-Attestations account(s) having API EDGE active subscription

tags.name: Thirdparties
tags.description: Account's thirdparties. You monitor a thirdparty with one of several 'dossier' configured with a set of requirements

tags.name: Dossiers
tags.description: Account's dossiers are sets of requirements/documents ask for one thirdparty. The dossier is your management unit. You can have multiple dossiers per thirdparties for different use cases. Feel free to contact e-Atestations to help you defining your dossier's configuration sets.

tags.name: Documents
tags.description:
Documents are the available requirements to your account that you can use. 
You define a set of documents/requirements for on dossier to monitor one thirdparty. 
You can use standard documents from e-Attestations or custom ones (by contacting your key account manager).

tags.name: Files
tags.description:
Files are provided either 

- automaticaly by e-Attestations
- automaticaly added by e-Attestations from a number of providers
- uploaded by a given thirdparty at your request

A file is an evidence, so you'll find 'evidences' in your 'dossiers'. 

Within a evidence you can find file if the requirement expect on, but not necesseraly.

tags.name: Requirements
tags.description:
Requirements are set for your account that you can use as 'documents' in one or more dossiers.

Requirements can have three types: 

- a form to fill
- a file to upload
- a signature provided by the thirdparty. 

You use the documentCode of the requirement in your dossier's creation.

A requirement becomes a document if it's set in a dossier.
